alert.note: Alert for Maury; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Maury and south central Williamson Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 500 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Thompson`s Station to near Columbia. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Spring Hill, Mount Pleasant, Thompson`s Station and I-65 East Of Columbia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 43 and 58. Interstate 840 between mile markers 22 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
